conference.title: International Conference on Advanced Communications and Computation

organization.summerize: The International Conference on Advanced Communications and Computation (INFOCOMP) serves as a forum for researchers in education and industry from all over the world to interact with one another and disseminate the latest developments in the fields of computer and information science. INFOCOMP 2025 will be held in Valencia, Spain, from April 06, 2025 to April 10, 2025.
organization.callForPaper:
INFOCOMP 2025 invites submissions on a wide range of topics, including:

*   **Submission Deadline:** January 20, 2025
*   **Notification:** February 16, 2025
*   **Registration:** February 28, 2025
*   **Camera Ready:** March 05, 2025
*   **Publication:** Published by IARIA Press and archived in the Open Access IARIA ThinkMind Digital Library.
*   **Topics of Interest:** Advanced Communications and Computation, Trends and advances on architecture/methods, Trends and advances on disciplines/applications, Large scale and fast computation, Programming models, Networks/systems communications, Networks/systems measurement, control and management, Turbulence modeling and simulation, Legal context, economic use and re-use, Evaluation context, Biometry, security, access technologies, algorithms, and applications.

conference.title: ACM Int'l Symposium on Field Programmable Gate Arrays

organization.summerize: The ACM/SIGDA International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays (ISFPGA) is a premier conference for the presentation of advances in FPGA technology. In 2025, the 33rd edition of ISFPGA will be held in Monterey, California, USA. Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings and available in the ACM Digital Library.
organization.callForPaper:
ISFPGA 2025 invites submissions related to advances in FPGA technology. Key details include:

*   **Submission Deadlines (AoE):**
    *   Abstracts Due: October 1, 2024
    *   Submissions Due: October 8, 2024
*   **Topics of Interest:** The conference seeks research papers related to a wide range of topics:
    *   FPGA Architecture
    *   FPGA Circuit Design
    *   CAD for FPGAs
    *   High-Level Abstractions and Tools for FPGAs
    *   FPGA-based and FPGA-like Computing Engines
    *   Applications and Design Studies
    *   AI/ML for and on FPGAs
*   **Submission Guidelines:**
    *   Papers should use the sigconf ACM format template.
    *   Submissions will be considered for acceptance as regular (10 pages max, excluding references) or short papers (6 pages max, excluding references).
    *   The FPGA Symposium uses a double-blind reviewing system.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** The conference will allow authors to submit accompanying artifacts for their paper submissions for evaluation.
*   **Double Blind Policy:** The FPGA Symposium uses a double-blind reviewing system. Manuscripts must not identify authors or their affiliations
topics: High-Level Abstractions and Tools for FPGAs

conference.title: ACIS Conference on Software Engineering Research, Management and Applications

organization.summerize: The 23rd IEEE/ACIS International Conference on Software Engineering, Management and Applications (SERA 2025) brings together researchers, scientists, engineers, industry practitioners, and students to discuss, encourage, and exchange new ideas, research results, and experiences on all aspects of Software Engineering, Management, and Applications. SERA 2025 aims to facilitate cross-fertilizations among key technology enabling areas.
organization.callForPaper:
SERA 2025 invites submissions of research papers on various aspects of Software Engineering, Management and Applications. Key dates include:

*   **Workshop/Special Session Proposal:** January 10, 2025
*   **Full Paper Submission:** March 28, 2025 (extended)
*   **Acceptance Notification (papers submitted by March 14):** April 4, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification (Papers submitted after March 14):** April 11, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Papers/Registration:** April 18, 2025

location.address: UNLV Campus, Las Vegas, Nevada, USA

dates.name: Acceptance Notification Papers submitted after March 14
Acceptance Notification papers submitted by March 14

conference.title: ACM Conference on Embedded Networked Sensor Systems

organization.summerize: ACM SenSys 2025, the 23rd ACM Conference on Embedded Networked Sensor Systems, will be held in Irvine, USA, from May 6-9, 2025. SenSys will continue as a SenSys event while transitioning toward a merger with IPSN and IoTDI, forming a single premier conference on Embedded Artificial Intelligence and Sensing Systems. SenSys 2025 will be collocated with CPS-IoT Week 2025, providing a unique opportunity for interdisciplinary exchange.
organization.callForPaper:
ACM SenSys 2025 invites submissions on networked sensor systems, embedded systems, mobile computing, the Internet of Things (IoT), wireless communications, signal processing, machine learning, cyber-physical systems, and AI-driven applications. The topics of interest include:

*   Sensors and Networked Sensing Systems
*   Platforms, Networking, and Communication Protocols
*   Embedded AI, Information Processing, and Machine Learning
*   Algorithms, Data, and Theory
*   Applications and Real-world Deployments
*   Security, and Privacy in Embedded Sensing Systems
*   Novel Paradigms and Architectures for Embedded Sensing Systems
*   Visions, Experiences, Tools, Datasets, and Benchmarks

Authors may choose to submit either as a full paper (12 pages) or a short paper (6 pages) for the 8th category. The submission must be unpublished and not currently under review for any other publication. The style files can be found on the conference website.

conference.title: IEEE International Conference on Computer Communications

organization.summerize: IEEE INFOCOM 2025, a top-ranked networking conference of the IEEE Communications Society, will take place in London, United Kingdom, as an in-person event. It solicits research papers describing significant and innovative research contributions to the field of computer and data communication networks, spanning both theoretical and systems research. Assistance for remote presentation may be considered for authors facing travel difficulties.
organization.callForPaper:
IEEE INFOCOM 2025 invites submissions on a wide range of research topics in computer and data communication networks, including:

*   Artificial Intelligence/Machine learning for networking
*   Cellular wireless broadband systems, including 6G and beyond
*   Censorship circumvention and net neutrality
*   Challenging Network Environments (underwater, underground)
*   Cloud computing/mobile cloud computing
*   Cross-layer designs
*   Cyber-physical network systems
*   Datacenter networking
*   Dynamic spectrum sharing
*   Edge and fog computing/networking
*   Extremely high-frequency communications (mmWave, THz)
*   Fault tolerance, reliability, and survivability
*   Full duplex communication networks
*   Green networks
*   Information-centric networking
*   Interference management and mitigation
*   Internet architectures
*   Internet of Things
*   Large-scale MIMO-based networking
*   Localization and location-based services
*   Medium access control
*   Mobile sensing and applications
*   Mobility management and models
*   Multimedia networking
*   Network economics and pricing
*   Network management
*   Network measurement and analysis
*   Network security and privacy
*   Network support for VR/AR
*   Network virtualization
*   Networked autonomous aerial/terrestrial/underwater systems
*   Non-terrestrial networks
*   Online social networks
*   Optical networks
*   Overlay and peer-to-peer networks
*   Quality-of-service and resource management
*   Quantum networking
*   Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) and Near-Field Communication (NFC)
*   Router and switch design
*   Routing and multicast
*   Scaling laws and fundamental limits
*   Software-defined networking (SDN)
*   Tactile Internet
*   Testbeds, experimentations, and networked experimental platforms
*   Ultra-Reliable Low-Latency Communications (URLLC)
*   Vehicular networks
*   Visible light communications (VLC)
*   Web applications and content distribution
*   Wireless local/personal area networks

Submissions are limited to 10 pages (9 pages main text and 1 page for references) and must use the standard IEEE Transactions templates. The submission website is accessible via [https://edas.info/newPaper.php?c=32265](https://edas.info/newPaper.php?c=32265).

conference.title: Association for Computer-Aided Architectural Design Research in Asia (CAADRIA) annual conference

organization.summerize: CAADRIA 2025, with the theme of 'Architectural Informatics,' reexamines the fundamental existence of architecture in the age of information technology. The conference is scheduled to be held in Tokyo from March 22-29, 2025. It invites original high-quality papers presenting current computer-aided architectural design research, accommodating a broad spectrum of approaches ranging from speculative, informal investigations to conventional scientific research.
organization.callForPaper:
CAADRIA 2025 invites original high-quality papers presenting current computer-aided architectural design research. Topics of interest include:

*   Artificial intelligence, neural networks and machine learning
*   Building Information Modeling (BIM)
*   City Information Modeling (CIM)
*   Collective, collaborative & interdisciplinary design
*   Computational design research & education
*   Design cognition and human-computer interaction
*   Disrupted practices, resilience, and social sustainability
*   Environmental and ecological performance
*   Generative, algorithmic & evolutionary design
*   Digital Heritage
*   Interactive environments
*   Material systems, processes and assembly
*   Practice-based design research
*   Robotics, digital fabrication and construction
*   Simulation, visualization and impact projection
*   Theory, philosophy & methodology of computational design research
*   Urban analytics, big data analysis and smart cities
*   AR / VR / XR
*   Application of technology in the context of the Asia-Pacific Region

Paper acceptance is subject to a two-stage reviewing process. CAADRIA 2025 also offers opportunities to submit a poster for the project exhibition, and Masterâ€™s and PhD students are invited to apply to present their research at the Postgraduate Student Consortium.

dates.name: Student Review of Architectural Informatics Society
Deadline for WS application for participants

conference.title: ACM SIGMOD-SIGACT-SIGART Conference on Principles of Database Systems

organization.summerize: The ACM SIGMOD/PODS Conference is a leading international forum for database researchers, practitioners, developers, and users. The 2025 conference will be held in Berlin, Germany, on June 22-27, 2025. The conference includes a technical program with research and industrial talks, tutorials, demos, and workshops.
organization.callForPaper:
The Principles of Database Systems (PODS) symposium invites scientific articles that present principled contributions to modeling, application, and system building in data management. Key aspects include:

*   **Mission:** To provide a solid scientific basis for methods, techniques, and solutions for data management challenges.
*   **Scope:** Scientific articles that present principled contributions to modeling, application, and system building in the context of data management.
*   **Topics of Interest:** Query evaluation, data models, data consistency, data mining, access control, privacy, data summarization, database interaction, and connections between database principles and other disciplines.
*   **Submission Format:** LaTex users must format their submission using the standard ACM 'acmsmall' proceedings stylesheet.
*   **Double-Anonymous Reviewing:** Submissions must adhere to the double-blind reviewing policy, with author names and institutions omitted.
*   **Important Dates:** The conference has two submission phases with deadlines for abstract, submission, rebuttal, and notification.
